sentences.sContent: A man can scarce allege his own merits with modesty, much less extol them; a man cannot sometimes brook to supplicate or beg; and a number of the like.
sentences.sContent_eng: A man can scarce allege his own merits with modesty, much less extol them; a man cannot sometimes brook to supplicate or beg; and a number of the like.
sentences.sCn: 一个人不能自承有功而免矜夸之嫌，更不用说是不能表扬自己底功绩了；他有时也不能低首下心地去有所恳求；诸如此类的事很多。

remMethod.val: sup(下面)+plic(重叠)+ate → 双膝跪下 → 恳求

trans.tranOther: to make a humble request to (someone); plead
